name: Titanium.UI.iOS.AdView
summary: The AdView is a view for display Apple iAds.

deprecated.notes: iAd has been deprecated in iOS 10 and SDK 5.5.0. It was removed as part of the SDK 7.0.0.

events.name: action
events.summary: Fired when a banner action is performed.

events.name: error
events.summary: Fired when a banner could not be loaded.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. May be undefined.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: Error message. Use the error property instead.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: load
events.summary: Fired when a banner is loaded and displayed.

methods.name: cancelAction
methods.summary: Cancel a banner to uncover the user interface.
methods.description: A banner view action can cover your application's user interface. However, your application continues to run, and receives events normally. If your application receives an event that requires the user's attention, it can programmatically cancel the action and uncover its interface by calling cancelAction. Canceling actions frequently can cause a loss of revenue for your application.

properties.name: adSize
properties.description:
Apple only allows setting ads as specific sizes, meaning that traditional view sizing does not affect ads. Ads always display in full-screen mode when a user clicks on them.

Should be set to either AD_SIZE_PORTRAIT or AD_SIZE_LANDSCAPE. Attempting to set this property to any other value will cause an exception.

Users are still allowed to set the view's width and height, but this does not affect the size of the ad itself. It is recommended that the auto value is used for these properties instead, to compute the view's size from the adSize.
